intro: Monopsis lutea var. subcoerulea, commonly known as the blue-flowered monopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated by gardeners interested in native or rare plant species.
